text: You shouldn’t include your hapikey on a frontend application because it would allow anyone to find it and access your account data

You should proxy the request through your own backend application. If you are trying to create a contact you could maybe use a HubSpot collected form <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/use-non-HubSpot-forms>

Hi all, to retrieve the domain name (primary) of a portal, I used to write {{ site_settings.domain }} but now I see that this variable is not valued. Can anyone tell me what is the settings variable to retrieve the primary domain of a portal? Thanks

Hello everybody!

We just got the “Policy and cookies” solution from HubSpot. I copied the link I got from them and pasted it on our <http://duda.co|duda.co> platform. Everything works fine except the “Cookie settings” button on the top left corner. I want to move this button to the left bottom corner of the website, or find another solution for this. Can you help me?

Hello everyone. I am curious what others are planning on doing with possible issues arising with company/contact associations from form submissions in HubSpot based on the new “hide my email” feature in the upcoming Apple Privacy updates? I know HS will look at website URL if the contact provides a freemail account but I’m not sure what these fake addresses will look like if that feature is turned on. Is it something we even need to be worried about?
Does hide my email mean that it's not going to actually insert the email
it allows users to cloak their email when submitting forms with a fake address that forwards to their real one.
so it would insert the fake address which I think would still deliver to the real one if you sent an email but causes problems with contact and company associations

<@U0154FHBYLD> - This is the method that we offer: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/files/update_file_access|Update access of a group of files in file manager.>
Also, <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/files/check_accessibility_task_status|here's> a way to track the task status.

Thanks! Btw, this client is really bent out of shape that HubSpot has no solution for this file security element. Looks like we’re going to have to host the files outside of HubSpot to incorporate some other options. Hopefully this is something that can be addressed at some point.
it seems that it will look something like this: `<unique-alphanumeric-string>@privaterelay.appleid.com` so you could do some tests and see if it interferes with your setup
it seems that it will definatelly mess with associations

I’m following up on how I solved this problem, in case any one else faces this issue and uses the search function. I had to go back and redo the drag and drop templates that used that deprecated custom hubl module and include that in the wrapping html part of the header”.  This problem is further agravated from these old 2018 templates, as the stylsheets were linked to the template using the built in way to attach them in design manager. When switching to a new template, the old stylesheets were still loading in. I had to re move the built in links on the sidebar and code the style sheet links into the old template. Then once we switched over, the old stylesheets did not come with.

hey guys so I am following the docs exactly with my auth flow in a nextjs build -- now in postman -- and got this back for the grant_type...is something weird with the encoding on the HubSpot endpoint?

I am using a serverless function to connect in Next, now I am using <http://onegraph.com|onegraph.com> as a middleman to see if that helps but no dice -- it is being returned as a 200 from onegraph but throwing this bad grant type message. I do have a "code" being returned in the query params of the url when the user clicks on the button to be redirected and authorized which I'm parsing nad forwarding to this callback

authorization_code

is there something else that needs to be appended?prepended?
